conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
A contains blue liquid, B contains cyan liquid, C contains yellow liquid, D contains cyan liquid, E is a blue container, and F is a yellow container.
The image shows various colored bars (red, yellow, black, purple, pink) positioned as baffles, directing the flow of liquid.
The blue liquid flows from A, initially directed downwards.
The flow from A is blocked by the horizontal red bar and then flows rightward, bypassing the red bar.
The liquid from A is directed downwards again, navigating through the black bar.
The liquid from A continues downwards and flows into the blue container E.
The cyan liquid flows from B, initially directed downwards.
The flow from B is blocked by the red bar and then flows rightward, bypassing the red bar.
The liquid from B flows downwards, navigates past the yellow bar, and moves leftward.
As the liquid from B flows leftward, it is directed towards the black bar.
The liquid from B continues straight and merges with the flow from A, entering container E.
The yellow liquid flows from C, initially directed downwards.
The flow from C bypasses the yellow bar and flows rightward.
The liquid from C continues rightward, flows past the purple bar, and then navigates downwards.
The liquid from C moves leftward around the black bar and is directed towards the yellow container F.
The cyan liquid flows from D, initially directed downwards.
The flow from D flows rightward, bypassing the purple and pink bars.
The liquid from D flows downwards and continues towards the yellow container F.
A and B flow into container E, while C and D flow into container F.
The liquid from A and B will flow into container E, while the liquid from C and D will flow into container F.
